meanings.definition: A motley assortment of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The school play included a variety of ragtags in different costumes.
meanings.sent2: The ragtags at the flea market were selling all sorts of trinkets.
meanings.sent3: The ragtags at the party made for an interesting mix of characters.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the crowd resembled a sea of ragtags.
meanings.sent5: The box of old toys was a treasure trove of ragtags waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: A group of people regarded as disreputable or worthless.
meanings.sent1: The town's ragtags often gathered near the abandoned building.
meanings.sent2: The ragtags loitering on the street corner drew unwanted attention.
meanings.sent3: The ragtags in the alley were up to no good, causing mischief.
meanings.sent4: The ragtags in the park seemed to blend into the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The group of ragtags were known for causing trouble in the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: She rummaged through the box of ragtags, looking for a missing button.
meanings.sent2: The garage sale had a table full of ragtags waiting to be sold.
meanings.sent3: The bag of ragtags she brought home turned out to be full of surprises.
meanings.sent4: The drawer was filled with a jumble of ragtags collected over the years.
meanings.sent5: The box of kitchen ragtags included odd utensils and mismatched dishes.
